original: @211b # // rgya gar skad du /🔽tsa tur mu dra au pa de sha n'a ma /
analyzed: @211b # // rgya gar skad du / tsa tur mu dra au pa de sha n'a ma /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Caturmudropadeśa-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: phyag rgya bzhi'i man ngag ces bya ba /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi'i man ngag ces bya ba /
translated: The Instruction on the Four Mudras

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med cing //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med cing //
translated: Emptiness and compassion inseparable,

original: zab cing rang bzhin brtag dka' ba //
analyzed: zab cing rang bzhin brtag dka' ba //
translated: profound and naturally difficult to fathom,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: the essence of mahāmudrā—

original: phyag 'tshal nas ni de nyid bshad //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas ni de nyid bshad //
translated: having paid homage, I shall explain that suchness.

original: de la man ngag la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas thog mar grub mtha' dag shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la man ngag la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas thog mar grub mtha' dag shes par bya ste /
translated: Regarding that, a yogi who wishes to enter the instruction should first understand all philosophical tenets.

original: de yang theg pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang theg pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of vehicles:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
translated: the śrāvaka vehicle, the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the Mahāyāna.

original: de nyid gnas pa bzhi ste bye brag tu smra bar gnas pa dang / mdo sde par gnas pa dang / rnam par rig par gnas pa dang / dbu mar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnas pa bzhi ste bye brag tu smra bar gnas pa dang / mdo sde par gnas pa dang / rnam par rig par gnas pa dang / dbu mar gnas pa'o //
translated: There are four abodes: the abode of the Vaibhāṣikas, the abode of the Sautrāntikas, the abode of the Vijñānavādins, and the abode of the Mādhyamikas.

original: de dag nyid sbyor ba dgu ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid sbyor ba dgu ste /
translated: Those are the nine applications.

original: nyan thos rab 'bring gsum dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mdo sde pa dang / rnam bcas dang / rnam med dang / sgyu ma lta bu gnyis su med par smra ba'i dbu ma @212a * //
analyzed: nyan thos rab 'bring gsum dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mdo sde pa dang / rnam bcas dang / rnam med dang / sgyu ma lta bu gnyis su med par smra ba'i dbu ma @212a * //
translated: The three types of śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, the Sautrāntikas, the Proponents of Features, the Proponents of No Features, and the Mādhyamikas who speak of illusionlike nonduality and the Mādhyamikas who speak of the complete nonabiding of all phenomena.

original: dang ; chos thams cad rab tu mi gnas par smra ba'i dbu ma dag re re la yang dpyad pa'i sgo dang / bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi dri ma dang / lta ba ste bzhi bzhi'o //
analyzed: dang ; chos thams cad rab tu mi gnas par smra ba'i dbu ma dag re re la yang dpyad pa'i sgo dang / bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi dri ma dang / lta ba ste bzhi bzhi'o //
translated: Each of these has four topics: the door of analysis, meditative concentration, stains of meditative concentration, and view.

original: de la dpyad pa ni thos bsam la brten pa'i rang gi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab bo ;
analyzed: de la dpyad pa ni thos bsam la brten pa'i rang gi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab bo ;
translated: “ Analysis” refers to the wisdom of individual investigation that is based on listening and reflecting.

original: / bsam gtan ni rang gi bsgom pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: / bsam gtan ni rang gi bsgom pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: “ Meditative concentration” refers to the wisdom of meditation.

original: bsam gtan gyi dri ma ni de'i dngos su mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dri ma ni de'i dngos su mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: “ Stains of meditative concentration” are factors that are directly incompatible with that.

original: lta ba ni rang gi shes rab kyis zin pa'i khyad par dang / rang gi 'bras bu la blos yul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni rang gi shes rab kyis zin pa'i khyad par dang / rang gi 'bras bu la blos yul du byed pa'o //
translated: “ View” refers to the distinctive wisdom that is embraced by that and the mental engagement with the result of that.

original: de la nyan thos tha ma'i spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de la nyan thos tha ma'i spyod pa ni /
translated: The conduct of the lowest śrāvakas is as follows.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don khas len pa sngon du 'gro bas brjod du med pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don khas len pa sngon du 'gro bas brjod du med pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'o //
translated: They assert a person that is inexpressible, preceded by the assertion of objects such as blue.🔽

original: 'bring po ni de dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring po ni de dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The moderate view is similar to that.

original: rab ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pas gang zag stong par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rab ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pas gang zag stong par lta ba'o //
translated: The superior view is the view of the emptiness of the person by means of thoroughly knowing the four noble truths.

original: rang rgyal ni gzung ba stong zhing 'dzin pa khas len pa'o //
analyzed: rang rgyal ni gzung ba stong zhing 'dzin pa khas len pa'o //
translated: The pratyekabuddha view is the emptiness of the object and the assertion of the subject.

original: mdo sde pa ni gzung ba 'dus par 'dod cing 'dzin pa tshogs drug go //
analyzed: mdo sde pa ni gzung ba 'dus par 'dod cing 'dzin pa tshogs drug go //
translated: The Sautrantika view is the assertion that the object is a collection and the subject is the six collections.

original: rnam bcas ni thams cad shes pa'i rnam par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam bcas ni thams cad shes pa'i rnam par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The view of the Vaibhasikas is that everything is asserted to be the nature of consciousness.

original: sna tshogs gnyis su med par 'dod pa'o //🔽rnam med ni 'di dag thams cad sems nyid de /
analyzed: sna tshogs gnyis su med par 'dod pa'o // rnam med ni 'di dag thams cad sems nyid de /
translated: The view of the Chittamātra is that the variety is nondual.

original: rnam pa med par rig pa'i ngo bor 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med par rig pa'i ngo bor 'dod pa'o //
translated: The view of the Proponents of No Features is that all of that is the nature of mind, which is the entity of cognition that is without features.

original: sgyu ma lta bu ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yang dag pa'i dngos pos stong pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yang dag pa'i dngos pos stong pa ste /
translated: The view of the Illusionlike One is that all phenomena are like illusions and are empty of real entities.

original: de nyid gnyis su med par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su med par 'dod pa'o //
translated: That itself is asserted to be nondual.

original: rab tu mi gnas pa ni tha snyad thams cad ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas pa ni tha snyad thams cad ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: Non-abiding is the analysis that all conventions are merely indications,

original: don gyi ngo bo cir yang mi gnas pa'o zhes dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo cir yang mi gnas pa'o zhes dpyod pa'o //
translated: and that the essence of the object does not abide in any way.

original: bsam gtan ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa dang / srog dang rtsol ba bgrang ba la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi bden pa mar me bsad pa lta bu ci yang mi snang ba la sems gnas pa dang / sna'i rtse mor gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa dang / srog dang rtsol ba bgrang ba la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi bden pa mar me bsad pa lta bu ci yang mi snang ba la sems gnas pa dang / sna'i rtse mor gnas pa dang /
translated: Meditation is abiding in the meditation on repulsiveness, in the counting of the life-force and exertion, in the non-appearance of the truth of emptiness like a blown-out lamp, in abiding in the mind, in abiding in the tip of the nose,

original: dkyil 'khor bsdus nas sems gnas pa dang / sems kyi rnam pa la sems gnas pa dang / rnam pa med pa la gnas pa dang gzugs brnyan la gnas pa dang / cir yang ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bsdus nas sems gnas pa dang / sems kyi rnam pa la sems gnas pa dang / rnam pa med pa la gnas pa dang gzugs brnyan la gnas pa dang / cir yang ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: in abiding in the mind by gathering the maṇḍala, in abiding in the mind in the aspect of the mind, in abiding in the aspectless, in abiding in the reflection, and in abiding in the essence that is not established as anything.

original: de la sems kyi rnam pa la gnas par bya ba ni dang bor ci yang rung ba la shes pa gtad /
analyzed: de la sems kyi rnam pa la gnas par bya ba ni dang bor ci yang rung ba la shes pa gtad /
translated: Among those, abiding in the aspect of the mind is first focusing the mind on anything at all.

original: de nyid sems tsam du shes par byas te gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems tsam du shes par byas te gnas pa'o //
translated: Having understood that to be mind only, abide.

original: rnam pa med pa la @212b gnas pa ni thog mar mchod pa la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa la @212b gnas pa ni thog mar mchod pa la sogs pa byas te /
translated: The one who abides in the absence of aspects first makes offerings and so forth.

original: slob ma stan la bzhag la dbugs sor bcug ste /
analyzed: slob ma stan la bzhag la dbugs sor bcug ste /
translated: Then, having placed the disciple on a seat, one should inhale for ten counts.

original: thog mar me tog lta bu la shes pa gtong du bcug nas lag pa spyi bor bzhag la sngags 'di brjod do //
analyzed: thog mar me tog lta bu la shes pa gtong du bcug nas lag pa spyi bor bzhag la sngags 'di brjod do //
translated: First, one should have the disciple focus the mind on something like a flower. Placing one's hand on the crown of the disciple's head, one should recite this mantra:

original: aom aa ra ra h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom aa ra ra h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ ara ara hūṃ hūṃ.

original: aom badzra yo gi n'i aa dhi tishtha h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra yo gi n'i aa dhi tishtha h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra yoginī adhi tiṣṭha hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces pa'i mgor rang gi yi dam gyi sngags brjod do //
analyzed: ces pa'i mgor rang gi yi dam gyi sngags brjod do //
translated: At the beginning of that, one should recite one's own deity's mantra.

original: de nas me tog kyang med par byas na myur du skye'o //
analyzed: de nas me tog kyang med par byas na myur du skye'o //
translated: Then, if one removes even the flower, [the disciple] will quickly generate [the deity].

original: bsam gtan gyi dri ma rnams dang / lta ba rnams ni gzhan nas gsal bas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dri ma rnams dang / lta ba rnams ni gzhan nas gsal bas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: The stains of concentration and the views are clarified elsewhere, so they are not mentioned here.

original: de ltar na mi mkhas pa rab rib can dang / mkhas pa rab rib med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi mkhas pa rab rib can dang / mkhas pa rab rib med pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are the unskillful, the ones with cataracts, and the skillful, the ones without cataracts.

original: de dag gi snying rje yang sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi snying rje yang sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Their compassion is also threefold: compassion focused on sentient beings, compassion focused on phenomena, and non-referential compassion.

original: de la gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni theg pa gsum las ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de la gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni theg pa gsum las ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The vehicle of the mantra is the Great Vehicle among the three vehicles.

original: gnas pa ni phyi ma gnyis so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni phyi ma gnyis so //
translated: The two latter ones are the abodes.

original: sbyor ba ni tha ma bzhi la'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni tha ma bzhi la'o //
translated: The four latter ones are the applications.

original: de la slob dpon nyid kyi gzhung gis ni rab tu mi gnas par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la slob dpon nyid kyi gzhung gis ni rab tu mi gnas par sbyor ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the non-abiding application is by means of the master's own text.

original: de lta na yang de dang thams cad du khyad med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dang thams cad du khyad med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the case that there is no difference from that.

original: ji skad du /🔽don gcig na yang ma rmongs dang // thabs mang dka' ba med pa dang // dbang po rnon pos dbang byas phyir //
analyzed: ji skad du / don gcig na yang ma rmongs dang // thabs mang dka' ba med pa dang // dbang po rnon pos dbang byas phyir //
translated: As it is said:🔽Even with the same meaning, the mantra vehicle is superior🔽because of non-confusion, many methods, no difficulty,

original: sngags kyi theg pa khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa khyad par 'phags //
translated: and being for those with sharp faculties.

original: zhes gsungs pas de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, that should be stated.

original: phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa'o //
translated: The outer creation stage, the profound creation stage, the completion stage, the fully complete stage, and the stage of the essence.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang / rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang / rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: Again, there is the solace of the Tathāgata and the solace of Vajradhara.

original: yang kun brtags la gzhan dbang gi rgya dang // gzhan dbang la yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su grub pa la rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de nyid la bde ba chen pos rgyas gdab pa'o //
analyzed: yang kun brtags la gzhan dbang gi rgya dang // gzhan dbang la yongs su grub pa dang / yongs su grub pa la rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de nyid la bde ba chen pos rgyas gdab pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the imagined is sealed by the dependent, the dependent is sealed by the real, the real is sealed by Vajrasattva, and that itself is sealed by great bliss.

original: yang phyag rgya bzhi las rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: yang phyag rgya bzhi las rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the four seals should be understood as follows.

original: las kyi phyag rgya ni zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya ni zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The action seal is the profound creation stage and the completion stage.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The doctrine seal is the complete stage.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa'o //
translated: The great seal is the stage of reality.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //🔽kun brtags @213a * //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'o // kun brtags @213a * //
translated: The pledge seal is the outer creation stage.

original: la gzhan dbang gi rgya ni phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: la gzhan dbang gi rgya ni phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The dependent seal of the imagined is the outer creation stage.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rgya ni lha thams cad kyang rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rgya ni lha thams cad kyang rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: The seal of the real is that all deities are mere awareness.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rgya ni rnam rig stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rgya ni rnam rig stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The seal of Vajrasattva is the knowledge that awareness is emptiness.

original: bde ba chen po'i rgya ni de nyid man ngag nyams su myang bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rgya ni de nyid man ngag nyams su myang bar byas pa'o //
translated: The seal of great bliss is the experience of the intimate instruction of that.

original: las kyi phyag rgya ni dbang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya ni dbang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The karmamudra is the essence of empowerment.

original: de yang bum pa dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab ye shes dang / bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bum pa dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab ye shes dang / bzhi pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the vase empowerment, the secret empowerment, the gnosis of the wisdom consort empowerment, and the fourth empowerment.

original: bum pa ni slob dpon gyi dbang man chad de /
analyzed: bum pa ni slob dpon gyi dbang man chad de /
translated: The vase empowerment is the master empowerment and below.

original: lus dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus dag par byed pa'o //
translated: It purifies the body.

original: gsang ba ni thabs shes rab gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems ster ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba ni thabs shes rab gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems ster ba ste /
translated: The secret empowerment is the bestowal of the bodhicitta that arises from the union of method and wisdom.

original: ngag dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag dag par byed pa'o //
translated: It purifies the voice.

original: shes rab ye shes ni gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab ye shes ni gsum ste /
translated: The gnosis of the wisdom consort empowerment is threefold:

original: drag po dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po'o //
analyzed: drag po dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po'o //
translated: fierce, bad, and good.

original: de la drag po ni 'o dang 'khyud pa nas brtsams te phyi rol gyi bya ba ni dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de la drag po ni 'o dang 'khyud pa nas brtsams te phyi rol gyi bya ba ni dga' ba ste /
translated: The fierce one is the joy that arises from the external activities that begin with kissing and embracing.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs so //
translated: It is the various aspects.

original: bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam par smin pa ste mchog dga'o //
analyzed: bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam par smin pa ste mchog dga'o //
translated: The ripening is the supreme joy that arises from the union of the churning and the churned.

original: rin po cher nyams su myong ba ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste dga' bral lo //
analyzed: rin po cher nyams su myong ba ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste dga' bral lo //
translated: The absence of characteristics is the joy of separation that arises from the experience of the jewel.

original: padmar lhung ba ni rnam par nyed pa ste /
analyzed: padmar lhung ba ni rnam par nyed pa ste /
translated: Falling into the lotus is the dissolution,🔽which is the innate joy.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes 'dod pa ste ltung dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes 'dod pa ste ltung dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: This is the assertion, but it contradicts the fall.

original: lung las mchog dga' bral dga' dbus dag tu //
analyzed: lung las mchog dga' bral dga' dbus dag tu //
translated: In the scriptures, the supreme joy is in the middle of the joy of separation.

original: mtshon bya shes nas brtags par gyis //
analyzed: mtshon bya shes nas brtags par gyis //
translated: Having known the object of illustration, examine it.

original: zhes pa dang / yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / yang /
translated: And also:

original: dga' bral dang po mchog mtha' can //
analyzed: dga' bral dang po mchog mtha' can //
translated: The first of the joys of separation has a supreme end.🔽And so on.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / yang dga' ba bzhi ni dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / yang dga' ba bzhi ni dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Also, the four joys are joy, supreme joy, innate joy, and the joy of separation.

original: 'on te lung las lhan cig skyes pa mtha' mar yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lung las lhan cig skyes pa mtha' mar yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the innate is at the end in the scriptures,

original: yang bden mod kyi /
analyzed: yang bden mod kyi /
translated: that is also true.

original: de ni bla ma la ltos pa dang bral ba glegs bam gyis mkhas par gang zag dag gis phyed du dkrugs nas bshad de /
analyzed: de ni bla ma la ltos pa dang bral ba glegs bam gyis mkhas par gang zag dag gis phyed du dkrugs nas bshad de /
translated: But that is explained by those who are not dependent on the guru, who are learned in the scriptures, and who are confused by the individual.

original: 'dir grangs kyi bzhi bar 'dug kyang don gyi gsum par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir grangs kyi bzhi bar 'dug kyang don gyi gsum par sbyar ro //
translated: Although it is the fourth in number here, it is applied as the third in meaning.

original: de nas 'dir drag po'i sbyor ba ni go rims dang don gnyis ka la mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dir drag po'i sbyor ba ni go rims dang don gnyis ka la mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: Now, here, the violent application is both unskillful with respect to sequence and meaning.

original: da ni dbang bskur ngan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dbang bskur ngan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the bad consecration should be stated.

original: 'o dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi bya ba ni @213b rnam pa sna tshogs te dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'o dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi bya ba ni @213b rnam pa sna tshogs te dga' ba'o //
translated: The external activity such as kissing, embracing, etc. is the various kinds of joy.

original: bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam par smin pa ste mchog dga'o //
analyzed: bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam par smin pa ste mchog dga'o //
translated: The union of the churning and the churned is the maturation, the supreme joy.

original: rin po cher nyams su myong ba ni mtshan nyid bral ba ste lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rin po cher nyams su myong ba ni mtshan nyid bral ba ste lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The experience in the jewel is the absence of characteristics, the innate joy.

original: padmar lhung ba ni rnam par nyed pa ste dga' bral lo zhes 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: padmar lhung ba ni rnam par nyed pa ste dga' bral lo zhes 'dod pa ste /
translated: The falling into the lotus is the dissolution, the joy of separation.

original: mu stegs pa dang khyad med pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa dang khyad med pa'o //
translated: This is asserted, but it is no different from the tīrthikas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyams su myong ba la yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba la yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the perfect grasping of the experience.

original: de ni go rims la mkhas kyang don la mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni go rims la mkhas kyang don la mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: That is unskillful with respect to sequence, but skillful with respect to meaning.

original: da ni dbang bskur bzang po brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dbang bskur bzang po brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the good consecration should be stated.

original: 'di'i lugs kyis dga' ba bzhi ni 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i lugs kyis dga' ba bzhi ni 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: In this system, the four joys are to be understood as follows.

original: phyi rol gyi bya ba nas bskyod pa'i mthar thug pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bya ba nas bskyod pa'i mthar thug pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The ultimate movement from external activities is the joy of the various aspects.

original: rin po che'i mthar thug pa nyams su myong ba ni rnam par smin pa ste mchog dga'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i mthar thug pa nyams su myong ba ni rnam par smin pa ste mchog dga'o //
translated: The experience of the ultimate jewel is the supreme joy, the maturation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān has said:

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
translated: The one with the drop of the half of the half of sixteen🔽Resides in the form of four drops.

original: zhes bya ba'i thig le bzhi'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa las gnyis ni rdo rje rtse mo'i cha la gnas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i thig le bzhi'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa las gnyis ni rdo rje rtse mo'i cha la gnas /
translated: Two are located in the tip of the vajra,

original: gnyis ni padma'i ze'u 'bru'i cha la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste lhan skyes pa'i //
analyzed: gnyis ni padma'i ze'u 'bru'i cha la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste lhan skyes pa'i //
translated: and two are located in the pistil cup of the lotus.

original: thig le bzhi char yang padma'i cha la gnas pa ni rnam pa med pa ste dga' bral lo //
analyzed: thig le bzhi char yang padma'i cha la gnas pa ni rnam pa med pa ste dga' bral lo //
translated: The four drops located in the lotus are without aspects, the joy of separation.🔽Moreover:

original: de yang / shes rab bcu drug lon pa la //
analyzed: de yang / shes rab bcu drug lon pa la //
translated: The one who has reached sixteen years of wisdom

original: lag pa gnyis kyis 'khyud nas ni //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis 'khyud nas ni //
translated: is embraced with both hands.

original: rdo rje dril bu mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The vajra and the bell are joined in union.

original: slob dpon dbang du shes par bya //
analyzed: slob dpon dbang du shes par bya //
translated: One should know the master empowerment.

original: zhes pa dang / dbang ni bzhi yi grangs kyis kyang //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dbang ni bzhi yi grangs kyis kyang //
translated: The four empowerments

original: dga' ba la sogs rim shes bya //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs rim shes bya //
translated: should be known as the sequence of joy and so forth.

original: zhes pa dang / thams cad gsang pa'i rgyud las kyang //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / thams cad gsang pa'i rgyud las kyang //
translated: And in the All Secret Tantra:

original: gnyis shor gnyis ni mnyam pa'i dbus //
analyzed: gnyis shor gnyis ni mnyam pa'i dbus //
translated: The two lost, the two equal in the middle,🔽the vajra touches the lotus,

original: rdo rje nas ni padmar reg / rgyu la 'bras bus rgyas gdab cing //
analyzed: rdo rje nas ni padmar reg / rgyu la 'bras bus rgyas gdab cing //
translated: the result seals the cause,

original: 'di ni bde chen rgyal po'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni bde chen rgyal po'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: this is the king of great bliss.

original: de ltar na drag po'i sbyor ba ni mi bskyod pa'i rgya dang bral la dbang bskur ngan pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rgya dang bral zhing rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na drag po'i sbyor ba ni mi bskyod pa'i rgya dang bral la dbang bskur ngan pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rgya dang bral zhing rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Thus, the union of fierce fire is free from the seal of Akṣobhya, and the bad empowerment is free from the seal of Vajrasattva and free from the encouragement of Vajradhara.

original: 'dir rdo rje sems dpas mi bskyod pa la rgyas btab pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //🔽de yang lung las mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par bstan pa dang / shin tu rgyas par @214a * //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje sems dpas mi bskyod pa la rgyas btab pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo // de yang lung las mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas par bstan pa dang / shin tu rgyas par @214a * //
translated: Here, the seal of Vajrasattva on Akṣobhya is the middle path.

original: bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is taught in the scriptures in brief, in extensive [form], and in very extensive [form].

original: de dag ni dbang ga 'grel pa nyid na gsal bas 'dir ma bris so //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang ga 'grel pa nyid na gsal bas 'dir ma bris so //
translated: Since they are clear in the commentary on the first stage, I will not write about them here.

original: de ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ste yid d'ga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ste yid d'ga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: That is the wisdom-knowledge initiation, which delights the mind.

original: bzhi pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi rang bzhin dga' ba gsum dang tha mi dad pa rten 'brel gyi ngo bor zung du 'jug pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi rang bzhin dga' ba gsum dang tha mi dad pa rten 'brel gyi ngo bor zung du 'jug pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the union of the three joys, which are not different from the nature of the wisdom-knowledge initiation, in the essence of dependent origination.

original: de dag ni las kyi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni las kyi phyag rgya ste /
translated: Those are the karma consort.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bshad do //
translated: It is explained by master Nagarjuna that they generate the result that is similar to the cause.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni snang grags kyi chos sna tshogs su snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni snang grags kyi chos sna tshogs su snang ba nyid de /
translated: The dharma consort is the various phenomena of appearances and sounds.

original: de yang las kyi phyag rgya'i lhan cig skyes pa nyid las grol ba sna tshogs kyi rtog pa 'byung ba dang / sna tshogs kyi rtog pa'i gags shing lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs su gnas pa dang / sna tshogs dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid du med pa dang /
analyzed: de yang las kyi phyag rgya'i lhan cig skyes pa nyid las grol ba sna tshogs kyi rtog pa 'byung ba dang / sna tshogs kyi rtog pa'i gags shing lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs su gnas pa dang / sna tshogs dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid du med pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the simultaneous arising of the karma consort is liberated from the various conceptual thoughts that arise, the various conceptual thoughts that obstruct the simultaneous arising, the simultaneous arising that abides as form, and the simultaneous arising that does not exist.

original: sna tshogs dang lhan cig skyes pa gnyis ka'i rtog pa mi dmigs pa dang bzhi ni chos kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba dang / mchog dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes dga' dang / dga' bral lo //
analyzed: sna tshogs dang lhan cig skyes pa gnyis ka'i rtog pa mi dmigs pa dang bzhi ni chos kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba dang / mchog dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes dga' dang / dga' bral lo //
translated: The four joys of the dharma mudra are the joy of the non-observation of both the various and the connate, the supreme joy, the connate joy, and the joy of separation from joy.

original: des na chos kyi phyag rgya ni dngos po ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin las ma bcos pa'i phyag rgya chen po skye ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na chos kyi phyag rgya ni dngos po ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin las ma bcos pa'i phyag rgya chen po skye ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since the dharma mudra arises from the nature of the unfabricated entity, it is called the ripened result.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i ngo bo zung du 'jug pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i ngo bo zung du 'jug pa /
translated: The mahamudra is the essence of the nonarising nature of all phenomena, the union.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
translated: It is free from the concepts of subject and object, and it abandons the afflictions, the obscurations of omniscience, and so on.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: It is the experience of the nature of one’s own characteristics just as they are.

original: dri ma med pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
translated: It is called the stainless result.

original: de'i ngo bo ni mtha' dbus kyi chos thams cad gzugs can ma yin pa dang / thams cad du khyab pa dang mi 'gyur ba dang / dus thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni mtha' dbus kyi chos thams cad gzugs can ma yin pa dang / thams cad du khyab pa dang mi 'gyur ba dang / dus thams cad pa'o //
translated: Its essence is that all phenomena of periphery and center are not physical, are all-pervading, are unchanging, and are present at all times.

original: des na phyag rgya chen po ni skad cig ma gcig la mngon par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: des na phyag rgya chen po ni skad cig ma gcig la mngon par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: Thus, mahāmudrā is fully enlightened in a single instant.

original: skad cig ma bzhi dang / dga' ba bzhi dbye ba ni med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma bzhi dang / dga' ba bzhi dbye ba ni med do //
translated: There is no division into four moments and four ecstascies.

original: 'on kyang phyag rgya bzhi la ltos nas dga' ba bzhi bzhag ste las kyi phyag rgya ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyag rgya bzhi la ltos nas dga' ba bzhi bzhag ste las kyi phyag rgya ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the four ecstascies are posited in dependence on the four mudras: The action mudra is the ecstasy.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //🔽phyag rgya chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' @214b ba'o ;
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni mchog tu dga' ba'o // phyag rgya chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' @214b ba'o ;
translated: The dharma mudra is the sublime ecstasy.🔽Mahāmudrā is the innate ecstasy.

original: / dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni dga' bral lo //
analyzed: / dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni dga' bral lo //
translated: The samaya mudra is the ecstasy of separation.

original: de nyid ji lta ba bzhin chos kyi 'khor lo'i dus su bla ma'i zhal la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ji lta ba bzhin chos kyi 'khor lo'i dus su bla ma'i zhal la ltos par bya'o //
translated: Those should be viewed in the guru's mouth at the time of the dharma chakra just as it is.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni de kho na nyid mtshon par byed pa 'bras bu lha'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni de kho na nyid mtshon par byed pa 'bras bu lha'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The samaya mudra is the mandala of the result deity that illustrates reality.

original: de yang rje btsun gyis thabs mtshon pa dang / rje btsun mas shes rab mtshon pa dang / 'khyud pas gnyis su med pa mtshon pa'i phyir dam tshig go //
analyzed: de yang rje btsun gyis thabs mtshon pa dang / rje btsun mas shes rab mtshon pa dang / 'khyud pas gnyis su med pa mtshon pa'i phyir dam tshig go //
translated: Moreover, the master is the pledge because the master symbolizes the means, the mistress symbolizes wisdom, and the embrace symbolizes nonduality.

original: de yang bskyed pa'i rim pa bdun po dag par byas nas rgyu'i he ru ka bskyed pa dang / lha mo'i 'khor lo spro ba dang / nyi ma dang zla bar thig le'i gzugs su zhu ba dang / lha mo'i dbyangs kyis bskul ba dang //
analyzed: de yang bskyed pa'i rim pa bdun po dag par byas nas rgyu'i he ru ka bskyed pa dang / lha mo'i 'khor lo spro ba dang / nyi ma dang zla bar thig le'i gzugs su zhu ba dang / lha mo'i dbyangs kyis bskul ba dang //
translated: Moreover, the four joys of the pledge seal are the cause Heruka generated after purifying the seven stages of creation, the emanation of the circle of goddesses, the melting of the vital essence in the form of the sun and moon, and the urging by the song of the goddesses.

original: 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin par gyur pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dga' ba bzhi ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin par gyur pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dga' ba bzhi ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: The result, the transformation into the result Vajradhara, is the four joys of the pledge seal, respectively.

original: 'bras bu lha'i 'khor lo 'di ni 'gro ba'i don 'dzin par byed pas skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu lha'i 'khor lo 'di ni 'gro ba'i don 'dzin par byed pas skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu brjod do //
translated: This circle of result deities is said to be the human action result because it holds the meaning of migrating beings.

original: de ltar na phyag rgya bzhi la dga' ba bzhi bzhi ste bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na phyag rgya bzhi la dga' ba bzhi bzhi ste bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four joys of the four seals are to be understood as sixteen.

original: phyag rgya bzhi'i man ngag slob dpon gnyis med rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / rgya gar gyi mkhan po badzra p'ani dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong tshul khrims rgyal bas bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi'i man ngag slob dpon gnyis med rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so / // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po badzra p'ani dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong tshul khrims rgyal bas bsgyur ba'o//
translated: The instruction on the four seals composed by Master Advayavajra is complete.

original: ` // chos thams cad rab tu mi gnas par ston pa'i de kho na nyid tshigs su bcad pa byed kyi 'grel pa bzhugs /
analyzed: ` // chos thams cad rab tu mi gnas par ston pa'i de kho na nyid tshigs su bcad pa byed kyi 'grel pa bzhugs /
translated: The commentary on the verse that teaches the non-abiding of all phenomena, the way things really are, is complete.
